number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								UPDATE (Jan 30, 2015): This game is my new favourite in the library. Everything, plus many more things are added after my purchase and developer is continuing to update it EVERY Thursday without miss. Procedural galaxy (or map, whatever it is) with no boundaries made this a true jewel. I wonder if programming an AI is possible with the in-game coding system :)UPDATE (July 18, 2014): YAY! Batteries!!.. Developer is carefully listening to community and creating the game that players desire. That guy (Marek Rosa) deserves a space ship!.. really... I mean it! :)ORIGINAL ENTRY (July 2, 2014): Think of this game as a Minecraft in space. But with more in depth simulation and lethality.You can build any kind of ship or vessel as you like. You can even give them some useful roles to help you in your harsh quest for survival. Make them mining vessels and they will crush those asteroids to bits, allowing you to get minerals and raw ores faster. Or if you have enough materials, build a ship with welders to help you build that massive capital ship faster! If you think your old ships need salvaging or scrapping, add grinders to it and it will become a ship dismantler!The game has many different startup scenarios both in survival and creative mode. Something for everyone. You can get confused by the UI or HUD at first, but it becomes familiar over time. Game lacks a proper tutorial or detailed help because it is still in development. But you can find vast amount of information from the community and wiki site. A little tip for begineers: If you start to play survival, try to find an uranium deposit ASAP. Everything is dependent on it!I'll give it 9/10 points overall and definitely suggest it to anyone that loves creativity based games. In my opinion, this price is acceptable for such game. (Let's be honest lads!)As far as I played, I never encountered any bugs. My gaming rig only slowed down while the resolution is set to 1920x1080 fullscreen. I don't know the reason, but playing the game in windowed mode solved that, and I'm playing in windowed mode since then. Not too much of a problem if you ask me..."If only there were batteries or battery blocks (that can be charged with electricity) that are reusable over and over!"

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Space is a cold, unforgiving place.  This is the world that waits for you in Space Engineers, a voxel-based sandbox game similar to Minecraft but with enough twists to mark its own territory in the genre.In Space Engineers, you must temper the harsh realities of space with a limited set of tools:  A space suit that lasts only a few minutes before requiring a recharge, a set of construction tools (Welder, Grinder, and Drill), and perhaps a space station or ship to keep you alive with scant Uranium fuel.  To last more than a couple of hours, you must find more fuel, via mining ore, which must be put through a refinery before it can be used.  Without Uranium, you can't make more, so making a mistake will cost you your life - and if your ship runs out of fuel - may cost you your progress.  Beyond basic survival, the stars are the limit.  You have your choice of producing the parts for and constructing small ships, large ships, or space stations.  The latter two cost an incredible amount of resources but are strangely satisfying to slave away welding together 2.5 metre blocks of steel for hours on end.  Time invested mining can be minimized with construction of a mining ship and a base to properly refine your ore.Though scarcely an Alpha version, Space Engineers is an incredibly fun and rewarding experience, but as such you must be willing to put up with occasional glitches and clunky multiplayer.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Effectively Minecraft in Space thus far, the game is still entertaining. Multiplayer makes this highly enjoyable (though there are some issues for some players who experience horrific Lag when Mining, for example). Irrespective, this can be worked round and not everyone suffers from it.Everything is simple, with all building blocks having clearly defined components you'll need, Mining is easy and everything is a matter of time and effort as opposed to needing an in-depth knowledge of anything. Artificial gravity, turrets and more make a PvP-style experience all possible with weaponry available to engage in Astronaut-on-Astronaut fighting if needs be.In keeping with the Minecraft comment, building small, large and station-sized ships or building is easily achievable. If you can commit the patience you can build up just about anything, with doors and rotational motors allowing you to even put moving parts in place. Already there are a swathe of amazing designs out there that players have put together, from creatively put together mining and processing plants that can devour whole asteroids, to replicas of Battlestar Galactica and Imperial Star Destroyers and Warhammer 40,000 ships.Granted this isn't yet a "finished" product, but that aside it's still a great deal of fun. You can import and export your designs and have them tossed into someone else's server with little effort, play creative or use the "survival" mode. Some of the discussions on the forums have seen rise to a lot of great suggestions for Mods and enhancements when such things are possible. It's a great game with greater potential but even as-is, it's got the strength to continue to be a rewarding and entertaining experience.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2013
Early Access Review
								Every single time I put this game down thinking I'm done for a bit, I think of another interesting thing I can build and test out and have to load the game back up and start testing it. A new ram, different shape ships, a new mechanism that could work just so or something really daft like a small ship made almost entirely out of small warheads. At the moment, multiplayer is just single player with more people, but that works. Things are made infinitely more fun with the inclusion of other people and Space Engineers is no different. For those of you waiting to get SE when multiplayer was added, now is your chance.-:Update:-New survival mode is awesome. Crafting can be a bit daunting at first, but once you get the hang of it, it all comes together and makes even the simplest construction feel fantastic! The lack of objectives in single player survival might put some off, but the multiplayer survival is going to be great co-op or versus fun :D-:Update number 2:-Ok, having limited things and trying to create complicated things by using those really limited simple things was really good fun right? Space Engineers is still good, don't get me wrong, but sandbox games always seem to do this; they take those really complex ideas people have... and simplify them. They simplify them, cram them into an in-game, single, EASY item... and make it boring. Previously, if you wanted a door, you built one. You set up rotors, maybe even pistons in the later iterations, connector blocks, convoluted processes to do the simplest things. Now, you place a door block. Job Done. No challenge, no creativity. Slap a block down, wham! instant door.Personally, this turns things dull for me, but if you like this kind of thing, definitely check out SE as it has only been made better in that respects. This has been a fantastic game from the beginning.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Space Engineers: Early Access Alpha Review - This review is for Alpha build 1.038.013 Is This Game for Me?First thing you might ask is, is this game worth getting? That depends on a few things. First and foremost is do you like building games? If you like building games like Minecraft or Terraria and you have a PC that can handle it, then without reservation I can say you’d be crazy NOT to get it. What Kind of Game is It?What is Space Engineers exactly? If I could describe it one sentence I’d say it’s a Newtonian physics based space simulation/voxel-based building/survival game. I’m nearing 400 hours into the game and I’m showing no signs of losing interest any time soon. Those who know me, know there are only two other games I’ve put more than a 100 hours into; Mass Effect 3 and Skyrim. That’s pretty rarified company for an indie developed, $20 game. In Space Engineers you scavenge or mine for resources that you then make into building components with which you use to build stuff. At the same time you have to survive the harsh environment of space. It’s an Alpha!Yes it is an alpha game which nine times out of ten means it’s a buggy mess (more or less) with few features implemented. Not so with Space Engineers. It’s a remarkably stable for an early access game and though the full list of features are far from having been implemented, it already has a very robust feature list that has kept me busy for nearly 400 hours and counting. This doesn’t mean you won’t encounter bugs. You will, but they are very seldom game breaking and the devs have displayed a pattern of working hard to address bugs on a regular basis.   Patchmas!!!!What’s Patchmas you ask? It’s something I’ve never seen a dev do. Every Thursday Keen Software House releases an update patch for the game which includes new items, new features  and bug fixes. Unlike other early access games you don’t have to wait for a month or two to get new features and see bugs fixed. With Space Engineers you’ll see something new every single week. That’s right. You heard me correctly. Every week you get new toys to play with in the game. And in between those patches, there are hotfixes that address bugs. So even though the game is far from finished, you’ll see new features added to the game EVERY WEEK. In fact, Keen has been quoted as saying they never want to stop developing the game, even after final release. Game ModesThere are three game modes. First is creative mode which allows you to build things without having to gather resources or worry about survival issues. Everything you build comes into being instantly instead of having to weld it together. You can’t die in creative mode. Second is survival mode which is either solo or you can have your friends come in and help you out. In this mode you must gather resources, make sure don’t die, and deal with hazards. Hazards are probably the most underdeveloped portion of the game presently but that’s definitely a feature in the game that promises to be very interesting once it’s progressed far enough in development.    The third mode is PvP with dedicated servers. I have very little experience with this mode as I don’t generally go for that kind of gameplay but from what I’ve seen on the Keen forums, which I monitor regularly, the PvP mode is the mode that is more prone to bugs and is not as far along in development as other modes in the game. Even given that, there’s still a LOT of people regularly playing in this mode. It’s something that very likely will become more awesome as the game progresses, and once it does progress far enough I might even give it a go even though I don’t usually go for PvP. In short, Space Engineers is a game that anyone who likes to build stuff would be crazy not to give a go. If you are one of those people, then pony up $20 and give it a go. I’m betting you won’t be sorry.Edit: I forgot to add that the game already had a dedicated modding community. The AAA SE mod pack is especially awesome. If you get the game, be sure to check it out on the Official Keen Software House forums. You won't be sorry you did.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I love this game! It has a building interface like that of minecraft, but includes the thrill of space travel and survival. It allows me to control how difficult the game is by manipulating the settings. The things you can do with the game are almost limitless with the availability of mods. If you get bored of fighting the A.I. in singleplayer, then you can test your survival skills online. All this being said, there is one problem; Waiting. However, I don't want to discourage anyone from getting this game. The waiting and lag is a huge problem for those who are only playing games for a few hours as opposed to the people who game at an intense level. It takes long to load even singleplayer worlds, and it might crash when it finally loads. The lag is immense, and I have not even tried online yet. But hey, it gives you time to do other things, like eat lunch while your game is loading. I guess this is why it is in alpha. If you have some patience and a love for survival games with limitless possibilities, then this game is for you. P.S. I have a pretty slow computer, so it is much better on gaming laptops and desktop computers.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								8.5/10There's only so much to say about this game, because I'm at a loss for words.This game is truly a masterpiece. An absolute treasure. The graphics look incredible, the soundtrack is intense, but also calming when it has to be. Gameplay could overall use a bit of work, but then again, this is an Alpha game.I'm normally not a person who likes to spend too much time on one game, however, Space Engineers has taken me by surprise. I've spend well over 250 hours on this game (and that says a lot when it comes to me, as I'm normally not using more than 80 hours on a game). It's addicting and intense. It plays well, mostly, and it gets updated every single thursday! Some updates are small, some are huge, but they all contribute to the game one way or another. I've spend a ton of time on it, and I'm ready to spend another 250 hours!Small note though: Don't start a new threat on their forums unless you wanna get bombarded by haters and critics. The people hanging out there are some of the most terrifying bunches I've ever encountered...- Jounzey (International YouTuber & Game Critic)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30
Early Access Review
								Post in two parts: Message to KSH/Marek, and a review/endorsement./// @ the Devs, Marek, KSH ///Hi Keen Software House!I LOVE YOU GUYS for making this game. However, I know how tired most of you devs must be by now, working on this title for so long. I know from experience as a mixed creative and technical guy the fatigue from working on a project for so long. Just know that you have a huge following, eventhough a majority of this following does not log in every day, or even every week. Look at the bump in players you had when planets were introduced; amazing! In any case; remember we are all rooting for you in creating this awesome survival/sandbox/scripted campaign multiplayer-driven game. (Yes, Marek; Multiplayer is focal here for the majority of us. Multiplayer is not just a feature! It's 2017 :P)/// Review & Endorsement ///I have thousands of hours into Minecraft, yet I always disliked that everything was stuck to a grid. In this game, there's dynamic voxel terrain, and there's grids of blocks. Separate, physical, grids of blocks. Blocks with their own physical behaviours too, such as rotors, thrusters, wheels with suspensions, pistons, connectors (connect grids). There's 'crafting', there's a survival mode that honestly does still need fleshing out, and most importantly there is the cluster♥♥♥♥ of blocks that you can put together in an infinite amount of ways that'll create anything you set your mind to creating; from orbital bombers to scripted guided missiles, defender drones, mining ships, racing ships, friggin' lunar buggies, carrier ships, ALL THE SHIPS, and even stuff like tabletop games and♥♥♥♥♥♥ And next to all that you have a new scenario-maker that is the best 'build your own game'-game with ever better control over ever better AI. Yes, yes, and more yes. The potential is great, and as of right now is already much fun, if not for the buggy multiplayer and occasional physics screw-up.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								1/28/14What is amazing about this game is that it is only in alpha. This alpha phase game currently packs more features that most full games I have. It is truely unique and gives me a lot of hope. The developers are AMAZING and there are already a lot of youtube channels with how to guides on how to play. IT IS NOT YET FULLY FUNCTIONAL, but it is really close. The weapons on small ships and the automatic rifle and drills work. The best part, they just added multiplayer up to 16 people. it's still rough, but holy crap is it awesome. The graphics are really good and the building is really easy once you get into it. The only limit is your imagination. The physics of this game are as real as they can get without you needing to be an expert on space physics to play. There are a lot of things in this game to tickle your fancy. If I cannot convince you, look up Bradphusion on youtube and watch one or two of his videos. this game will keep me busy for years to come. Look out minecraft.REVIEW UPDATE 3/18/14It happened. KSH added the survival update. It is still a little raw and the implimetation of survival somehow messed up creative for some of my friends, but this game is getting better and better. I already play this way more than any of my other games. My recommendation is to get this game while it's still only $14.99. The devs have announced that they are going back to weekly updates. This game is just amazing.REVIEW UPDATE 5/9/14It's been some time since I've updated this review.The game is still going in a good direction. I am happy with every update as it nears completion.Cons: It can still be laggy on multiplayer, but they are optamizing it with every updateThe worlds are not yet unlimited, but there is enough to keep you busy for a really long time.Sadly the public multiplayer does have greifers, but every game has griefers.REVIEW UPDATE 12/11/2014Been a while since I have updated this review.But my recommendation stands. This game has only gotten better since the last review update.That being said, with almost 300 hours into this game, its flaws have started to show themselves to me.Pros:*You can build anything. The only limit is your imagination. 10/10 for freedom*Amazing mod support. There are mods to turn this game into anything you want. If you just want to build in creative for hours at a time, there are mods to enhance that. Want to have large scale fleet battles with your friends? Mods for weapons and combat blocks are also available. 10/10 for the mod community.*Amazing community. To many people, the fanbase of a game is enough to make or break a game. I am one of those people. No one should ever be afraid to voice a complaint, suggestion or question on a game forum. But so many communities have immature bullies that would rather make you feel bad for having a individual thought than welcome you and help you. This game has an outstanding community with groups for just about any aspect of the game. I used to be in charge of one of the first groups (MEC Enterprises) before life got in the way. There are groups for combat, piracy, building, survival, and even salvaging. Anyone can fit in in this game, and if you don't find something for you, make a group and post it to the hub. People would love to join you. 10/10 for the community.*Developers. The dev team is fantastic. I have never seen a better team. They actually listen to the community. We the players have as much of a voice in the creation of this game as they do. If a mod is popular enough, they add it to the vanilla version of the game. They have teamed up with a 3D printing company and when you build a ship, they can make a real life model and send it to you. They update every week. They have quality merchandise on their website and in general, they are just great. 10/10 for Developers. Keep up the great work guys.*Game Play. The game play is great. For zero gravity, the controls are very easy to grasp. switching from ZeroG to a gravity influenced area is without error. Gun play is pretty bad, but it's not a major part or the game and thus not a high priority. Ship weapons and fighter combat on the other hand are amazing yet challenging. Combat in ZeroG is a whole new beast and it doesn't help the fact that you don't know what you are about to get into a dogfight with because they built it. It's both exciting and a new challenge. Building is amazing. If you thought minecraft had building down to a T, this game will blow you away. There are just so many features to building paired with being able to rotate yourself to get a better angle. One of their updates added a projector block, so you can build a ship in creative and then save it as a blueprint, and then you can transfer it over to a survival world where the projector sets up a hologram for you to follow when building the ship. Gameplay 9.7/10 (They had to lose some points for the gunplay).Cons:*AI. This is a frequent issue from the community. There is no danger in this game. In minecraft, you have mobs. The worst you get in this game is drifting ships with guns and meteor showers. The lack of danger is my biggest issue. The only reason I want to play survival is because I want to see if I can survive. For a uncharted asteroid belt in outer space, there are surprisingly few threats to challenge you. The only thing that I felt challenged was my patience. The best you can do right now is try to find a PvP server or set something up with friends. That being said, the devs may be planning something so we will wait and see. There is also a way to script basic AI, so I imagine there is something to be found in the steam workshop for download.*Limitations. While the world can be set to unlimited, there is no procedural generation. You spawn in an asteroid cluster and the asteroids you see are the only ones around you. You can keep going but you will find nothing. There is nothing to explore. **This being said, there was a blog post from the head of the development team earlier this week saying that they will not only add procedural asteroid generation, but they also plan to add direlect ships and stations for you to explore. They will be using designs from the community for the most part.*Survival. I have no issue with creative, but for me, survival got boring after about 3-4 hours and I went back to dumping a couple hundred hours into creative. Overall I do not recommend buying this game solely for survival mode, but I recommend it for creative and the community, and to be a part of the creation of the best voxel game I have ever seen.TL;DR Buy this game.

Early Access Review
								It's looking great, lots of potential, constant updating (which is expected from an unreleased game, but still), great feedback.I have my fingers crossed on this one.As of 11 of August 2014: Still looking great, and it's nice to see that the developers are taking their time to hear the opinions of the community. The engine is also showing some promise, very versatile, decent performance and graphics. It still needs a lot of work though.However, I'm afraid that the game is starting to get a bit rushed. Big updates that get pushed forward due to the mass begging from the community. We are patient, the game's great already, much better than most fully(?) released games (like Ubisoft/EA's main titles), so take your time, on "small" things like optimization and small content addition (like block forms, small glass blocks, etc).

content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Now I was a little hesitant on writing a review about this game because truthfully I didn't know what I was going to say. But now I believe I have come up with a good enough review to share to everyone. This game drops you into space with no intructions except for a few hints here and there but they expect you to build whatever you would like. If you are a fan of any space simulation games then this one is just right. Star Cittizen was shown off at PAX east 2014 and that looked beautiful but if your trying to decide if you want SC or SE then it is completely up to you. SE is a work in progess. Having been just released as an early acess alpha game the game is improving one update by a time. This game will remind you of Minecraft in space and that is a good thing if you like Minecraft but if you want this to be a completely different experience than Minecraft then you can change it. The game allows you to write its story and play the game you want to. If you like making large space stations inside an asteroid or loading a large ship with warheads you can do that. There is nothing telling you you can't. The movement is ok. I feel as if the jetpack doesn't go fast enough to slow you down after you drift away from a platform. The graphics at the highest setting still look slightly dull but they will hopefully be improved by the games full release. This game invovles sandbox building and the "do what ever you want" element in it which blends perfectly. I would highly recommend  this game to anyone. Space the final frontier is only a mouse click away!

content:

Early Access Review
								About the closest start to a perfect game that I have seen in 20 years of gaming. What it does, it does well. You build. The combat isn't sharp or exact, the graphics aren't pushing the boundries of science. You can build complicated machinery designed to handle all kinds of tasks. Your own imagination provides the bulk of the game's content. The level of creativity that you can bring to bear in the game is varied enough to occupy both myself and my 11 year old son, to the point where we have conversations about the game when not playing the game.I'm extremely excited to see where the developers take us next, and with weekly content updates we are getting there in a hurry.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's looking great, lots of potential, constant updating (which is expected from an unreleased game, but still), great feedback.I have my fingers crossed on this one.As of 11 of August 2014: Still looking great, and it's nice to see that the developers are taking their time to hear the opinions of the community. The engine is also showing some promise, very versatile, decent performance and graphics. It still needs a lot of work though.However, I'm afraid that the game is starting to get a bit rushed. Big updates that get pushed forward due to the mass begging from the community. We are patient, the game's great already, much better than most fully(?) released games (like Ubisoft/EA's main titles), so take your time, on "small" things like optimization and small content addition (like block forms, small glass blocks, etc).

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								1/28/14What is amazing about this game is that it is only in alpha. This alpha phase game currently packs more features that most full games I have. It is truely unique and gives me a lot of hope. The developers are AMAZING and there are already a lot of youtube channels with how to guides on how to play. IT IS NOT YET FULLY FUNCTIONAL, but it is really close. The weapons on small ships and the automatic rifle and drills work. The best part, they just added multiplayer up to 16 people. it's still rough, but holy crap is it awesome. The graphics are really good and the building is really easy once you get into it. The only limit is your imagination. The physics of this game are as real as they can get without you needing to be an expert on space physics to play. There are a lot of things in this game to tickle your fancy. If I cannot convince you, look up Bradphusion on youtube and watch one or two of his videos. this game will keep me busy for years to come. Look out minecraft.REVIEW UPDATE 3/18/14It happened. KSH added the survival update. It is still a little raw and the implimetation of survival somehow messed up creative for some of my friends, but this game is getting better and better. I already play this way more than any of my other games. My recommendation is to get this game while it's still only $14.99. The devs have announced that they are going back to weekly updates. This game is just amazing.REVIEW UPDATE 5/9/14It's been some time since I've updated this review.The game is still going in a good direction. I am happy with every update as it nears completion.Cons: It can still be laggy on multiplayer, but they are optamizing it with every updateThe worlds are not yet unlimited, but there is enough to keep you busy for a really long time.Sadly the public multiplayer does have greifers, but every game has griefers.REVIEW UPDATE 12/11/2014Been a while since I have updated this review.But my recommendation stands. This game has only gotten better since the last review update.That being said, with almost 300 hours into this game, its flaws have started to show themselves to me.Pros:*You can build anything. The only limit is your imagination. 10/10 for freedom*Amazing mod support. There are mods to turn this game into anything you want. If you just want to build in creative for hours at a time, there are mods to enhance that. Want to have large scale fleet battles with your friends? Mods for weapons and combat blocks are also available. 10/10 for the mod community.*Amazing community. To many people, the fanbase of a game is enough to make or break a game. I am one of those people. No one should ever be afraid to voice a complaint, suggestion or question on a game forum. But so many communities have immature bullies that would rather make you feel bad for having a individual thought than welcome you and help you. This game has an outstanding community with groups for just about any aspect of the game. I used to be in charge of one of the first groups (MEC Enterprises) before life got in the way. There are groups for combat, piracy, building, survival, and even salvaging. Anyone can fit in in this game, and if you don't find something for you, make a group and post it to the hub. People would love to join you. 10/10 for the community.*Developers. The dev team is fantastic. I have never seen a better team. They actually listen to the community. We the players have as much of a voice in the creation of this game as they do. If a mod is popular enough, they add it to the vanilla version of the game. They have teamed up with a 3D printing company and when you build a ship, they can make a real life model and send it to you. They update every week. They have quality merchandise on their website and in general, they are just great. 10/10 for Developers. Keep up the great work guys.*Game Play. The game play is great. For zero gravity, the controls are very easy to grasp. switching from ZeroG to a gravity influenced area is without error. Gun play is pretty bad, but it's not a major part or the game and thus not a high priority. Ship weapons and fighter combat on the other hand are amazing yet challenging. Combat in ZeroG is a whole new beast and it doesn't help the fact that you don't know what you are about to get into a dogfight with because they built it. It's both exciting and a new challenge. Building is amazing. If you thought minecraft had building down to a T, this game will blow you away. There are just so many features to building paired with being able to rotate yourself to get a better angle. One of their updates added a projector block, so you can build a ship in creative and then save it as a blueprint, and then you can transfer it over to a survival world where the projector sets up a hologram for you to follow when building the ship. Gameplay 9.7/10 (They had to lose some points for the gunplay).Cons:*AI. This is a frequent issue from the community. There is no danger in this game. In minecraft, you have mobs. The worst you get in this game is drifting ships with guns and meteor showers. The lack of danger is my biggest issue. The only reason I want to play survival is because I want to see if I can survive. For a uncharted asteroid belt in outer space, there are surprisingly few threats to challenge you. The only thing that I felt challenged was my patience. The best you can do right now is try to find a PvP server or set something up with friends. That being said, the devs may be planning something so we will wait and see. There is also a way to script basic AI, so I imagine there is something to be found in the steam workshop for download.*Limitations. While the world can be set to unlimited, there is no procedural generation. You spawn in an asteroid cluster and the asteroids you see are the only ones around you. You can keep going but you will find nothing. There is nothing to explore. **This being said, there was a blog post from the head of the development team earlier this week saying that they will not only add procedural asteroid generation, but they also plan to add direlect ships and stations for you to explore. They will be using designs from the community for the most part.*Survival. I have no issue with creative, but for me, survival got boring after about 3-4 hours and I went back to dumping a couple hundred hours into creative. Overall I do not recommend buying this game solely for survival mode, but I recommend it for creative and the community, and to be a part of the creation of the best voxel game I have ever seen.TL;DR Buy this game.

								Let's be honest... this game isn't finished yet, and I don't expect it to be for many more years... But in the other hand, you've never seen a game with this physics engine (look at all these bu.. features!), and even if there is a lot of work to do to make this game playable at a reasonable level of headaches, playing it is worth it!Sure if you whant to play multiplayer with your friends, even in creative, you'll see more time going into setting up a proper connection without 'any' bugs (some of them are really, really weird... Have you ever seen a planet desapear in real life? If not, this game is for you!) than into building things and doing some CQ... But at the same time, the stuff that you can come up with in this game is incredible, just take a look at the workshop for example... type in the name of a ship that you've seen in a movie or in a game, and you'll find it!If you ever whant to play this game, don't expect everything do work from start, but give it a bit of love and you'll get it back!

content:
Posted: February 17
Early Access Review
								I highly recommend playing Space Engineers on either a newer or the latest gaming PCs or laptops as the workload will quickly overwhelm anything else after twenty to thirty minutes.Active community and one of the coolest Workshops you'll see on Steam!I've been on this game for years now and I'm very glad that I stuck it through all the bugs, glitched, and other issues because things are coming together in an awesome way with a spectacular overhaul of the block graphics. Everything is even more machine-like than before!I live the dream of being a spacer here, surveying planets and launching probes to the moon. I drift between asteroids out in stellar space, dodging meteors and launching raids on pirate caches and bases while repeling Argentavis raids. Sometimes I'll play pirate myself and go after commercial freighters and mining ships or foolishly taking on a military minelayer or escort. All this while dealing with the problems actual engineers and programmers face.So go! Build an automated starship and crew with your friends or make a simple scrap ship and live the life of a salvage vagabond. Claim entire planets and systems as your own and cover them in cities or turn entire asteroids into weapons of war.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								Space Engineers brings to the table everything I wished Minecraft had. Being able to create objects in a setting is one thing. Being able to create objects in a sruvival setting is another thing. What Space Engineers does for the creative/survival sandbox genre is the freedom of utilizing your creations to solve complex problems in the context of early space exploration. If you love stretching your critical thinking and problem solving abilities, then look no further. This game is only in Alpha, and it's running better than most released games. You can drive your creations around, people. You can fly them, crash them, repair them, modify them, dodge asteroids in them, send them careening into space when you lose power! Add to that the willingness of the Devs to add community suggested changes to the game, and I can't wait to watch how this one evolves.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								There are a ton of space shooter games out there that simulate several kinds of space flight. They allow you to be merchants, pirates, fighters, traders and so on. Some space shooters allow you to travel to other worlds while others let you explore the expansive galaxy.Space Engineers takes space flight to a whole new level of space flight. This is not just a game, it's a creation tool. Space Engineers, not only allows you to fly through space and battle it out with your enemies, but this game lets you also "DESIGN" your ship the way you want it, exactly how YOU want it. Space flight is no longer about just ships, it's about designing and showing off your ship designing skills. You can design fighters, frieghters, destroyers, dreadnauts, even space stations that take HOURS to travel the entire station. YOu can even design fighter ships inside the frieghters or space stations, so you havesomething to defend your stations or frieghters. Not only can you build your fighters, but you can also travel to asteroids and drill for minerals to design stronger materials to make better ships/stations for yourself.Space Engineers also lets you do either single edit where you just edit the ship on your own without others watching you, or you can have others join you online, either as allies and team work your stations, ships, destroyers, or you can battle it out against your friends to see who will have the best fighter ships and who can build the better ships.Along with that, if you think you have designed a good ship, you can post your ship creations on the Steam site and you can also check out other designs that others have made and see how they designed their ships. (UPDATE = As of now there are over 1,000 pages of Workshop items to view and download. Ships, stations, animations, asteroids, destroyers, mechanical devices, there's just nolimit to what you can do.)Space Engineers is no longer about just space flight. It's about taking the entire "Build Your Space Empire" to a whole new level of build and destroy. Build it, design it, add on to it, tweek it, create it, and use it, any way you see fit. Space Engineers is no longer about the game, it's all about "YOU". What ship do YOU want to design, and how will you control the space empire? Space Engineers, you know you wanna be one... ^_^ (The game was still in Beta when this review was given, but during this time, they had updated the game so that you can do online battles or coop, how ever you want to play online)

content:
Posted: August 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								While the movement systems may seem confusing at first, this game allows so much more of the invention and engineering feel that I was looking for in a game than I've found elsewhere, with an ever-growing selection of intriguing mechanics.Where else do you ponder how to control space fighter traffic in a carrier to make reloading quick and easy and avoid not only collisions, but also cutting each other up with thruster backblast?This game throws novel problems at me and expects novel solutions from me, without being designed with a fixed list of solutions in mind. This is a thing that has gotten much easier with the invention of modern physics engines, etc.; but is still relatively rare and something I search far and wide for.I fully recommend this game, though keep in mind it's still in development and lacks a crucial Linux port (they made some bad design decisions locking themselves into Microsoft APIs instead of using standardised libraries). Time will tell if the Wine compatibility improves, as of this writing I'm booting into Windows 7 exclusively for this game.

content:

Early Access Review
								Josh told me to buy this, and he mentioned it is not the final game so I don't know if I wanted to buy it yet, but he was having so much fun while talking on skype so I had to try it myself.I did not watch anything (videos or tutorials) and just got straight into it. It was god damn hard at first but I have been on it for hours trying to create some small ships to start with. It really does take patience to create a huge ship but its up to you on how it will look.At first, I did crash the ships that already are loaded into the quick-start options and it was so fun to see the pyhsics of the damage the ship had taken, not to mention it was fun to crash a ship into another.I then started to get used to the Camera and how it works, it's hard starting out but you will get used to it.I could ramble on a lot for how much fun you will have playing this just in single-player, yet I think they are releasing multiplayer in an update. This is what I (any I could guess a lot of others) are looking forward too. Gathering resources together, building a station, a huge epic fleet of ships to maybe have a war.I am so looking forward to updates on this game.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Update: Now with planets!Space Engineers is a fun and relatively detailed sandbox game. The objective, is to build a ship and survive in your game world, You have to fight off pirates, mine for materials, and manage to survive the other players (in multiplayer). I myself spent the entire free weekend though in creative mode building an insanely large ship that had everything on it, looked nice, and managed to function reliably. I can't call myself experienced in Space Engineers whatsoever but I can say that if sandbox space building games interest you, or that my description of the game was intriguing, you should definitely give this game a look.

								In it's current state 8/11/14 something is wrong with it. I have enjoyed this game on a daily basis and the last 3 or 4 updates I have not been able to enjoy due to excessive lag, frame rate drop, and unplayable multiplayer. I encounter similar issues in single player, but not as severe. I am sure that these issues will be solved and the game will be playable again, so for that I give it a thumbs down. This game without the very recent issues and despite my machine being well over the recommended settings and still not being able to handle this game without terrible frame rate lag on a low resolution at minimum settings since recent updates, is a great game. I enjoyed it quite often prior to these events and would like to see it excell. After they figure out what is going on and fix the situation, then I can continue to recommend this game.EDIT: Sorry I forgot to ever edit this, but yes, the main issues are resolved. content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's looking great, lots of potential, constant updating (which is expected from an unreleased game, but still), great feedback.I have my fingers crossed on this one.As of 11 of August 2014: Still looking great, and it's nice to see that the developers are taking their time to hear the opinions of the community. The engine is also showing some promise, very versatile, decent performance and graphics. It still needs a lot of work though.However, I'm afraid that the game is starting to get a bit rushed. Big updates that get pushed forward due to the mass begging from the community. We are patient, the game's great already, much better than most fully(?) released games (like Ubisoft/EA's main titles), so take your time, on "small" things like optimization and small content addition (like block forms, small glass blocks, etc).

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Date posted: 16th Aug 2014TL:DR; Game engine and mechnics are finished, just needs more content. High Recommendation.For early access this is one of the most stable and polished early access games around. While the price is quite high it is clera the developers are constantly working on this game with updates every few weeks.Graphics are quite good for such a game and performance is fairly good considering what is being modelled. Super large ships will grind the game to a halt and it would be nice for some macro-based optimisations.Content is short, few colours, few block types (still a lot but not enough when compared to say minecraft).Gameplay has minor issues but nothing that ruins the gameplay. Game locks for a half second when saving and there is currently no way to brace for meteor impact. Also Gravity mechanic needs to become spherical to allow orbits etc.Creative mode is a nice little playground and features like copy & paste make for some interesting scenarios.Survival mode is good, however more events need to occur and possibly some NPC enemies/neutral/allies. My recommendations for survival mode additions are:- Solar Flare (turns all blocks off for 20 seconds, requires manual restart of systems)- Large Asteroids that move (this allows for large asteroid to smash into each other and send rocks flying out)- System degradation (systems over a long period of time should degrade)- System failure (if a reactor is comprimised there should be a chance of the reactor going critical and blowing up)- Unknown Event (An event that cannot be identified, power going out, ship being thrown across space etc)

content:

Early Access Review
								Space engineers is an awesome game. it feels like a game i can play for hours on end with friends and by my self. as the game is still in beta the bug count is very little. every friday it seams to be updated with new things (Last update was Wheels, some sorts of Auto aming turrets and some bug fixes) and keep me waiting for them to come into play. very realistic and lots of fun. Being able to have a mixture of ships deing different tasks and being able to set up space stations is really cool. My self, iv played the game for about 60ish hours (off the top of my head) and the things you can creat is endless. for example, Mining ships, Attack ships, stations with all sorts of creations on board, convyor systems and lots more. The price of the game is amazing for the content you get. only a few things i wish could be added and that is, being able to have a hive you could call it. where you can fly and find other peoples basses. (just on chance.) like every one builds on one huge world. endless astroyeds you can explore and build on. this would bring more meaning to the game, being able to conduct rades of other peoples bases. make the game more challening. and also adding in one huge thing. player interactiveness i gess. if this was added into the game i would find this to be one of the best games of the year. i recommend this game to people who enjoy survival, sandbox games. sorry for any spelling errors. -Santa-

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								10/10 game, me and a friend ran at each other (actually ran) misjudged our locations, collided, and we both died on impact. I got to watch as his body flew backwards and smacked the opposite side of the station while mine did the same. Excellent.Over the past few days this game has really grown on me and it is really looking good for the future based on my experience.While the game is still in development, at least at the time of this review, it is extremely fun to play. You are given full freedom to build the biggest, most ambitous thing you can think of. The only real limits right now are the time you can invest welding it all together and what your computer can handle. Even without the construction it is extremely satisying to smash two large ships together and watch parts fly off as sections are crushed, mangled, and turned to unrecognizeable chunks: which you can promptly take your welder to and fix right up only to smash them together again!If you enjoy building things via a minecraft-esque system while exploring asteroids for materials, or if you instead just like smashing  stuff together to see how twisted you can make the wreckage then I can definitely recommend this game.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I love this game! It has a building interface like that of minecraft, but includes the thrill of space travel and survival. It allows me to control how difficult the game is by manipulating the settings. The things you can do with the game are almost limitless with the availability of mods. If you get bored of fighting the A.I. in singleplayer, then you can test your survival skills online. All this being said, there is one problem; Waiting. However, I don't want to discourage anyone from getting this game. The waiting and lag is a huge problem for those who are only playing games for a few hours as opposed to the people who game at an intense level. It takes long to load even singleplayer worlds, and it might crash when it finally loads. The lag is immense, and I have not even tried online yet. But hey, it gives you time to do other things, like eat lunch while your game is loading. I guess this is why it is in alpha. If you have some patience and a love for survival games with limitless possibilities, then this game is for you. P.S. I have a pretty slow computer, so it is much better on gaming laptops and desktop computers.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								8.5/10There's only so much to say about this game, because I'm at a loss for words.This game is truly a masterpiece. An absolute treasure. The graphics look incredible, the soundtrack is intense, but also calming when it has to be. Gameplay could overall use a bit of work, but then again, this is an Alpha game.I'm normally not a person who likes to spend too much time on one game, however, Space Engineers has taken me by surprise. I've spend well over 250 hours on this game (and that says a lot when it comes to me, as I'm normally not using more than 80 hours on a game). It's addicting and intense. It plays well, mostly, and it gets updated every single thursday! Some updates are small, some are huge, but they all contribute to the game one way or another. I've spend a ton of time on it, and I'm ready to spend another 250 hours!Small note though: Don't start a new threat on their forums unless you wanna get bombarded by haters and critics. The people hanging out there are some of the most terrifying bunches I've ever encountered...- Jounzey (International YouTuber & Game Critic)

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								*UPDATE 10/9/2015*This game plays similarly to other survival voxel construction games.  You have a tech tree (everything's actually available, just need materials) that you work your way up through via mining and processing.  Since my initial review they've added so many large features like oxygen systems, infinite procedural worlds, AI pirate drones that attack you, sorting blocks that let you sort your cargo,  programming blocks that let you manipulate almost everything via C# programming, tons of performance fixes and updates, and now soon even planets with atmospheres and atmospheric thrusters.  Each time i've played the game i've usually spend about 15-25 hours getting to max tech with friends then again waiting for some large update.  Each time I want to do things differently, arrange things differently, and its a blast on every new world.*June 2014 Review*Got it on steam sale. Played 10 hours straight.  Went to bed at 5am.  10.1/10.

content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								I posted a review of Space Engineers 12th April, 2014, but a LOT has changed over the year.By Keen Software House, the same brilliant developers who were the brains behind the awesome Miner Wars: 2081, Space Engineers is a unique first-person survival sandbox, which you can see it's parents are clearly Minecraft, and Kerbal Space Program. As an astronaut space engineer, it's your job to survive the barren deserts of space that lie in each and every direction around you.Mine asteroids, or perhaps hollow them out and make a secret space station!Build a colossal space frigate with unimaginable firepower, then add hangers and smaller ships!Have a space race, only for it to become a dogfight to the death with gatling guns and missle launchers, only surviving with that fine♥♥♥♥♥ejector seat you built...More and more possiblities arrive with each mod and update released. Updates are released every Thursday for North America and Europe (I think), and every Friday for New Zealand, Australia, Asia, and other pacific locations. Each update typically contains bug fixes, additional features to already existing blocks, but moreso, blocks from mods and community requests.These are prime good developers, that LISTEN to the community! Something other people need to start doing. But back to these guys, they do respond, they do care, they always strive to add blocks and features that the community requests. Only a few weeks ago, we were asking for cameras, hangar doors, remote control, and they add it!Mod supportPistonsCamerasSCRIPTING/CODING!!!GunsMoar Gunz!MORE GUNS!The big one here is mod support. Almost everything you can possibly imagine, is somehow possible with content on the Steam Workshop, if not already possible in the game. AND. The most popular mods are actually getting INTERGRATED INTO THE GAME!!!Pistons, Cameras, Spherical Gravity Generators, Solar Panels, Wheels, 3 Cockpits, Windows, these were all originally mods, and now they've been merged with the game itself!Must. Buy.Pricewise, it's very good, considering the other pricey crap that share it's genre, it's not released yet, but certainly plays like it! Last but not least, this game is PC only at the moment, but will be getting a release on Xbox One. This version will recieve similar updates with the same content, however as of now, there is no mention of mod support on this version. I expect it'll be more expensive, so I personally would get the PC port over the XONE port.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								This was a very, very good and well done game. However, I find that "Different taste - ophobia," a disease common in video games, is REALLY bad here. Of course, given it's player base, it obviously appeals to a lot of people, but I had a bit of a hard time getting into this one. To quote the AVGN, "It's like trying to stick your **** into a cheerio."Survival!!!  It is a bit like minecraft, as in mining for, and collecting resources, and also mods, made easier with Steam workshop. And it's a bit not like minecraft, where, for one, it's on Steam, and also the graphics are smoth, the resources are different, and the setting is in space, thus what you build, what you craft, and by extension, how you craft, are completely different.  Also the fan base isn't filled to the brim with complete and total IDIOTS.  With that, experienced Minecraft players like myself (though I don't play it much anymore), or many survival games, shouldn't be alienated while it provides a new, fresh experience. It's good, but my main problem was I couldn't get into it. Probably just me though, don't let that get you down. ;)Creative!!!  What can I say, It's Garry's Mod, but in space!!! And Garry's Mod is an excellent game, and so is this. Build spaceships of ginormous porportions that would slow even an Alienware computer down, or just mess around with stuff. It's up to you.My Final say:  You know, I was a bit on the fence about this game, not being attached to it. And for the record, I LOVE space simulators. However, I ultimately decided to recommend this, as many others will go love this game to death. And to those who did, good for you! ;)

We already got a renewed renderer, and there are 3 multiplayer prototypes being tested to improve that department. Despite what some pessimistic people may think, this game still has a strong heartbeat. :)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								I really liked Minecraft and I am glad that one cannot see how many hours of my life I have logged into that game. So when I saw a review of this game I thought "wow, that looks like Gary's Mod and Minecraft had a baby, and then flung that baby into space." I really like the game though, because of the same "rules" that are applied in game. You try to survive in space, a very harsh and unforgiving environment, and mine different ores out of astroids to build your ship. Now this is only survival mode, which I have not played any of. My 50.1 hours of gameplay so far has been completely in the creative mode of the game, which allows the player to generate any of the "blocks" (I guess thats what I will call them). I have had a lot of fun designing and flying ships that I have built. Also, with the flying comes the physics engine, which is one of the best I have seen so far. The only trade off to a great physics engine is the occasional lag spike, during which the computer is calculating where all the bits of my ship have gone. Now, it is also like minecraft, in the sense that it can get monotonous. You do have to come up with projects to keep the game going. But this is only coming from my experience in the creative mode, survival mode may be much  more rewarding, and I am sorry to say that I just don't know. In conclusion, I love this game, I think that if you liked Minecraft, you will like this game as well, and when I say its like Minecraft in space, I mean it. Also, just a side note. The Dev for this game is a really good guy, and has been (so far...) continually pumping out new updates and listening to players from the forums. So in conclusion (again) get this game.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								As far as early acess games go, Space Engineers by far receives the most TLC from both devs and the workshop community. With Weekly updates both removing  bugs as well as consistently adding content that players want and care about, Space Engineers is shaping up to become one of the most broad and ludicrously fun space games on the market. Space Engineers is accessible enough to new players, as well as featuring a complexity curve that have you thinking of how establish and improve your designs for days on end. Highly recommended.

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm not going to lie, it's VERY laggy (at least if you have a potato computer like mine). But if you can get aside that (or go to a friends house where they have a good gaming computer), this can still be one of the best sandbox games you ever play. This is coming from a huge fan of both games, Space Engineers puts Minecraft to shame, and the detail and love you can put into your ships is amazing, until an asteroid says "f*** you" and destroys it. I love my ship, the USG Ghostlurker, and if you like space games and space combat/building, you'll love your's too. The best part is, in this game I was never killed over a can of beans or robbed of my pants, here the people are civilized.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Space Engineers is a pretty fun game (especially for creative type of people). there are small things that I hope will be added like tethering so you don't float away (or somthing that can hold you still since it can be difficult to make something in detail when you are just floating around). I think that currently it's strongest point is the destruction of the ships and stations (the videos on the store page shows the destruction pretty well). They've also implemented mining which seems kinda useless at the moment but you can dig your way through a asteroid so it's not all bad alternatively you can just attach a reocket launcher to one of your ships a blast your way through which seems to be much faster. The best features so far are just mostly what they've had in it for a while; crashing ships and building stations/ships. I also forgot to mention that there is currently multiplayer and it works well since you jsut have to create a custom game and select either offline, open, friends or private, it's much better multiplayer. 9/10 purely because playing alone isn't as fun as multiplayer (not complaining)

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								You know those promises made by every early access game producer?"We'll update every [relatively short time]!""We'll include these things before release!""We'll actually listen to people!"Well guess what?The Space Engineers devs really do update the game every week. And that's not just patches. They actually add content every week. I don't know how, but they do. If they say they will include a feature, you can probably expect it within the month. They are a bit notorious for simply deleting posts on their forums complaining about the game (or at least they were when I last went on there over a year ago), but they apparently actually listen if you have a polite suggestion. This development pattern is basically what all early access games WISH they could even pretend to have.Oh, and it sure as hell doesn't hurt that the game itself is also great.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I remember the Space Engineers of 1.024, back when large ship missile launchers exploded and the number of blocks fitted on a single page. Since then the devs have released a new update every Thursday  without fail, like a mini-Christmas each week. The game itself is excellent, and although the frequent releases often lead to bugs, they are rarely severe enough to impede gameplay. Playing creative or survival in single or multiplayer, this game can be anything you want: sandbox builder, exploration (worlds are effectively infinite in size), space or ground combat simulator, ruthless survival, or anything else that you can build or script; and new features are added every week. Pretty much anything that isn't already included in the game you can download from the workshop.Note: Low end computers may combust when playing on planets, but that will probably be fixed soon: I manage on a 2011 hp laptop

Early Access Review
								This is a good game. even at the alpha stages the game is easy to play and get into. The price is very small as aposed to other games. I have only had the game for a day and a half now and I have already spent 8 hours of my time in this game. The Physics engine is a bit perfomance hevey but you have to remember that this is a alpha game so it will be inproved a lot from its current state. I would recommend that you watch the help guide that is made by the devlopers or you can feel abit lost when you first get the game. To conclude I think that Space Engineers is a small game with lots of potental to be a well polished finished game. I already enjoy this game so much. I cannot wait for the developers to inprove it and bring out new content. If i was going to rate it out of 10 then I would give it a 9. But with time and development i think it could get a 10 from me.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Space Engineers is incredible. I think this is the best space game I've ever played, and it's easily my favourite game on steam, even in this stage of Early Access.I can't imagine what's going to be updated to this game next. The planets are absolutely huge, and you can literally do anything you want in this game.Also, the developers LISTEN TO THE COMMUNITY. So many developers of other games simply don't care about people who want to KEEP playing the game; they just make it interesting for the new players, and then they quit the game.But there are some things that I think should be worked on (yes, I realise that this game is still in early access, but I'm just pointing that out)Space Engineers is great, and in the sense that I don't really know what I would be playing when I don't have anything else to do, I also play it as a time consumer. And it's FUN. wait thats not even a time consumer but whateverIn addition, I love how modifications are easy to install, just subscribe, activate, and start. It's simple.I play this game every day, and 1 hour soars by in no time at all when I do play it. I could never stop playing this game, in fact sometimes I play it for an atrociously long periods of time.To conclude, as said before this is an amazing game and my most favourite game on Steam, and it will always be. (probably)

content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Some people could say this is a spin-off of minecraft, that it's unoriginal, that it's completely boring....... I would slap them upside the head for saying that cuz dis gaem is AWESOME!!first you're in spacesecond you can build a shipthird you can blow♥♥♥♥♥♥upthis game is so ingenuitive and amazing because of all the things you can do. If you're a Star Wars nerd like me, imagine any ship from Star Wars (the millienium falcon, the jedi starfighter, the y-wing, the x-wing) and relize that you can build all of them. If you like Star Trek, relize that you could build a replica of the Enterprise. Or, if you're that guy who wants to know what it's like to live in space, then survival is for you. Now, if you're the guy who doesn't know how to learn the controls by his or herself, then you can go to the very helpful Space Engineers website that has their own tutorial videos.(Trust me, you'll need them)If you're the guy who likes to build stuff and then blow the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it, then this is your game.All in all, this game is really fun, just don't expect it to be fun every moment you're playing, because it does require time and effort to make something worth while. But don't ever give up on something, because it's totally worth it in the end.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazing game. Even at early access it surpasses any and all expectations. In depth, detailed, innovative and extraordinary. You build anything you want, from replicas of real space ships to space stations and land rovers, to flying ♥♥♥♥♥ and missiles that penetrate the armor of your enemy and explode when inside. The modding community in this game is outstanding, Steam Workshop is integrated perfectly and I cannot wait to see what things are to come. The regular updates to the game also come out every single week, always adding a new feature. This game has accomplished and fixed much more in a way smaller timespan with a small indie team than a large budget AAA title. I recommend this game to anyone that has a system that can run it, as optimisation is great but not the best for very large ships. With 12 GB of RAM, 2GB of VRAM and a 3.9 GHz quad core CPU it brings my computer down to it's knees on certain creations that are uploaded unto the workshop. This does not detract from the experience, however. If you're looking for a flexible space building/space survival sim, please buy this while it's so cheap. This game has got an incredibly bright future ahead of itself and I am very glad that I bought this after leeching for a couple of months from pirated versions. The Steam version has way more features and looking back at my decision, this is one of my most satisfying purchases for a single game.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								A highly-technical, yet highly-creative open-world voxel-based building game, with a setting that will hugely appeal to sci-fi fans. It is currently in-development, with weekly updates constantly adding features and squashing bugs. Highly-addictive gameplay, comparable to that of certain other open-world voxel-based building games, with outstanding mod support. Set yourself a goal, and bam, 5 hours of your life is gone.It unfortunately sports a brief, but steep, learning curve, and requires kind of a decent rig to get acceptable performance, but I suspect the intended (and potential) audience for this game will be able to overcome these issues.

								I've played this "little" game for a while now. 3 Years early access is dangerous because, they add and add lots of things that i can't count, and the game is heavier every patch. Then they added planet to the game, and gravity field for each.That was the quitessence of the updates. From this time, I thought : "This survival space game is a master piece". I wonder what they added now, because my computer can't handle it anymore. To much data and interaction. Of course I could launch the smallest map, with the lowest quality, but what's the point ? This game deserves a brutal gamer computer to be enjoyed as it should be.So i'm sorry lovely engi, but i can't commend a game that i can't play, even if i bought it.Maybe in 2 or 3 years, when game will be stabilized and optimized, i will remove this view. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've had this game for over 2 years now.In the beginning it was very bug free, When new features were implemented, they had little effect on existing systems.I praised this game as a really good example of how early access should be done.But in the past 6 to 8 months something has changed. Whether they have new developers or what happened I don't know, but this game is now unplayable.There are a number of show-stopping bugs that creep up, and when you work your way around them, you get face-blasted with another stupid bug that prevents you from doing anything.None of the new features they have been attempting to add can be tested at all because of some basic bugs.Also this games direction to the realm of 'AI' is ridiculous. This was space 'engineering' and when they decided to add dogs and spiders before ever providing us with a proper linear bearing is unacceptable.Planets looks like a great idea, but they can't be bothered to fix the #1 transport that is needed. Wheels.Their steering mechanism is just all wheels = same angle, and makes driving impossible, and your creations will just explode when attempting to drive them anywhere.I do not recommend this game to anyone in its current state.I'm really disappointed with the way the development of this game has been going as of late.EDIT: 3 months later and 15min into the game, my character suddenly gets pulled and stuck in structures I'm attempting to weld or grind. This game is still a god damn mess. AVOID!!!!!!I've now uninstalled this game. It's not worth the HD space nor my time even glancing at updates coming in

								i have almost 800 hrs in this game, for first few months this game was extremly addictive for me, until the bugs just got worse and worse to where most my ships or mechs were broken, so i'd have to wait several weeks hoping the weekly update would fix them, to wait for 1 bug to get fixed and 10 more pop up. content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								I love games like Minecraft, Spore, Loadout, and GoD Factory: Wingmen that encourage their players to play their way to win. Space Engineers shows so much promise for being an early access game. It is a little grindy, especially if you don't set any multipliers on tool speed and output, but I'm beginning to realize that that is actually a very good thing. In Minecraft, if you lose a tool or stack of ores/blocks, it's not very hard to just go and get them all back. This game makes you value what you build and adds some very nice flavor/mechanics to the building process as well. And after you're done building, flying around in space ships of your own design, blowing stuff up is the freaking best!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								There's a lot of potential in this game. Just a quick peek at the workshop is enough to convince some people to buy this game, and Ive sunk many hours into the game experimenting with highly customized ships and diverse mods. Despite that, there are some things holding this game back that really detracted from my enjoyment and resulted in my recommendation to avoid this game. Mainly, poor optimization. Ive played single player and made numerous ships and stations, and each save game gets increasingly unplayable as I go. Framerate drops occur within an hour of playing and continue to decline. I can only put a dozen hours into a world before I'm forced to start over, unless constantly destroy old stuff as I go. And if you use mods, the same problems occur, at a much greater rate. Long-term goals and achivements haven't really been implemented, so there isn't much reason to play survival aside from increasing the time and difficulty it takes to build anything.  The game has also been in EA for three years and I'm unsure how well development will continue. I do think it's worthwhile keeping an eye on this, however.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Sure, it's in early access, but this is one of the few games I'd recommend bying despite being out so early.I mean, it's a space version of Minecraft, but instead of building static objects, you can make giant ships and crash them together, make smaller fighters to go about and destroy eachother, or sculpt asteroids to your liking with TBMs.What's not to like?With tons of options on how to build things, you can create pretty much anything you want. Whether it's a ship from a show you liked, or something you made up entirely, chances are you can make it look very similar to the original idea, if you put in some thought.There are numerous parts to choose from, and the creative mode is a ton of fun, it's mainly getting to create things.Survival sets different goals, survival, and has infinitely slower building, which is far more rewarding for the size of the built ship.As for the negatives (written 28/4/04), the multiplayer seems to have problems with ping, non-exploding objects, and sometimes rockets hitting their own launch tube if lagging even the slightest bit, but I'm sure they'll fix these issues.Same goes with performance. Lights are currently unnecessarily demanding, especially spotlights, but again, still in development and will surely get touched up.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Prior to the Multiplayer update, I would have easily given this game a negative review.  At first, I was very displeased with the developer of this game, mainly for not intending to include multiplayer, when his kickstarter clearly showed that Multiplayer was in the game.  It was a great disapointment when the developer said that he never, and nor does he now, have plans to release a multiplayer version.  I was sure that this was another one of those early access games where the developer makes his money, and then bails on the project.  However, the developer quickly got his act together, and decided to add multiplayer, and started doing updates at a very quick pace.  Now multiplayer is in the game, and I've got to tell you, its a whole new level of survival and multiplayer!This game has endless hours of content, and while it still needs a lot of improvement (Mainly how long it takes to build a space ship that can literally be destroyed in a fraction of a second), you can tell that it is now going places.I would highly recommend this game, even in its current state!  If you enjoy sandbox survival with mining and pvp, then stop thinking about it and just get this game!Keep up the good work Mr. Developer, your doing much better than you were before!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29
Early Access Review
								You need two things for this game: patience and imagination. So I would only recommend it for people who have both.Being fresh from alpha and only just hitting beta, the game still has bugs, which, from my own perspective are being ironed out.I mention perspective, because it seems that people with different machines, seem to have different experiences. Some have had little to no trouble with bugs. Others experience a few problems and others a lot (and it doesn't always seem to be computer spec related).Having got the negative out of the way, the game has so much potential and actually runs pretty well on my "average" PC.If you're a problem solver, then this will be right up your alley.If you're the type of gamer who just wants everything to work perfectly with absolutely no effort at all on your part, then you should leave this page. Now. The game is in beta, so you'll need to be a "guinea pig" for a while.Some people like being part of the development process and some don't.If you do - then totally get it.
